spinUntilFinished

protected org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.TerminationRecord spinUntilFinished(org.smartfrog.services.assertions.TestBlock testBlock,
                                                                        long timeout)
                                                                 throws java.lang.Throwable
Delay until a test has finished, sleeping (and yielding the CPU) until that point is reached. There is no timeout.

Parameters:
testBlock - component to spin on
timeout - how long to wait (in millis)
Returns:
the termination record of the component
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - if something went wrong

Parameters:

Throws:

runTestDeployment

protected org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.events.LifecycleEvent runTestDeployment(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                java.lang.String filename,
                                                                                int startupTimeout,
                                                                                int executeTimeout)
                                                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
This runs tests to completion, be it success or failure. The application is saved to the application field; the event sink to eventSink. Both will be cleaned up during teardown.

Parameters:
packageName - name of the package
filename - filename excluding .sf
startupTimeout - limit in millis to start up
executeTimeout - limit in millis to execute
Returns:
the lifecycle at the end of the run. This s either a TestCompletedEvent or a TerminatedEvent
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - on failure. A TestTimeoutException indicates timeout.

runTestDeployment

protected org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.events.LifecycleEvent runTestDeployment(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                java.lang.String filename)
                                                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
This runs tests to completion, be it success or failure. The application is saved to the application field; the event sink to eventSink. Both will be cleaned up during teardown.

Parameters:
packageName - name of the package
filename - filename excluding .sf The default test startup and execution timeout will be used, unless overridden by system properties.
Returns:
the lifecycle at the end of the run. This s either a TestCompletedEvent or a TerminatedEvent
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - on failure. A TestTimeoutException indicates timeout.

completeTestDeployment

protected org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events.TestCompletedEvent completeTestDeployment(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                             java.lang.String filename,
                                                                                             int startupTimeout,
                                                                                             int executeTimeout)
                                                                                      throws java.lang.Throwable
Run tests until they are completed, then analyse the results. The application is saved to the application field; the event sink to eventSink. Both will be cleaned up during teardown. The method will fail if the application terminated abnormally, or returned a test failure. Skipped and successful tests are both viewed as successes.

Parameters:
packageName - name of the package
filename - test file name, excluding .sf
startupTimeout - limit in millis to start up
executeTimeout - limit in millis to execute
Returns:
the test results
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - on any problem. A TestTimeoutException indicates timeout waiting for results An AssertionFailedError is raised if the tests were not successful

runTestsToCompletion

protected org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events.TestCompletedEvent runTestsToCompletion(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                           java.lang.String filename)
                                                                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
Run tests until they are completed, then analyse the results. The application is saved to the application field; the event sink to eventSink. Both will be cleaned up during teardown. The default test startup and execution timeout will be used, unless overridden by system properties. The method will fail if the application terminated abnormally, or returned a test failure. Skipped and successful tests are both viewed as successes.

Parameters:
packageName - name of the package
filename - test file name, excluding .sf
Returns:
the test results
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - on any problem. A TestTimeoutException indicates timeout waiting for results An AssertionFailedError is raised if the tests were not successful

getTestStartupTimeout

protected int getTestStartupTimeout()
Get the timeout for test startup -either the default or an overridden property

Returns:
time in MS for tests to start up

getTestTimeout

protected int getTestTimeout()
return the max time in milliseconds for tests

Returns:
the value set by a system property TestProperties.TEST_TIMEOUT_EXECUTE or the default getDefaultTestExecutionTimeout()

getDefaultTestExecutionTimeout

protected int getDefaultTestExecutionTimeout()
An override point for those tests that take a long time to run

Returns:
the time to execute tests

                                   boolean abnormalStatus,
                                   java.lang.String errorText)
Assert that a test failed for a specific reason

Parameters:
event - event to analyse
abnormalStatus - is an abnormal status expected
errorText - optional error text

expectSuccessfulTestRun

protected org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events.TestCompletedEvent expectSuccessfulTestRun(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                              java.lang.String filename)
                                                                                       throws java.lang.Throwable
Do a test run, assert that it passed and did not skip. The application and eventSink are both saved in member variables, ready for cleanup in teardown

Parameters:
packageName - package containing the deployment
filename - filename (with no .sf extension)
Returns:
the test completion event
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - if things go wrong

expectSuccessfulTestRunOrSkip

protected org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events.TestCompletedEvent expectSuccessfulTestRunOrSkip(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                                    java.lang.String filename)
                                                                                             throws java.lang.Throwable
Do a test run, assert that it passed or that it skipped. Skipped tests are warned about; there's no way to do anything else with them in JUnit3

Parameters:
packageName - package containing the deployment
filename - filename (with no .sf extension)
Returns:
the test completion event
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - if things go wrong

expectAbnormalTestRun

protected org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events.TestCompletedEvent expectAbnormalTestRun(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                                                            java.lang.String filename,
                                                                                            boolean abnormal,
                                                                                            java.lang.String errorText)
                                                                                     throws java.lang.Throwable
Do a test run, assert that it failed. The application and eventSink are both saved in member variables, ready for cleanup in teardown

Parameters:
packageName - package containing the deployment
filename - filename (with no .sf extension)
abnormal - flag to indicate an abnormal failure record is expected
errorText - optional error text to look for
Returns:
the test completion event
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - if things go wrong
